ai.summary: A gentle 3.2 km family-friendly loop at Harewoods near Limpsfield in the UK. The easy route features light footing and mostly flat terrain, making it suitable for children, beginners, and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Woodland trail with gravel and compact earth surfaces. Generally even underfoot, with shaded sections and occasional damp patches after rain. Mostly gentle gradients and a well-maintained path.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and supervise children at all times. Wear sturdy footwear and be prepared for changing weather. Check local notices for any closures, bring water, and keep to daylight hours. If using a pushchair, be aware some sections may be less even.
recommended_gear: Map, GPS, or a fully charged phone
Small first aid kit and insect repellent
Optional trekking poles or a collapsible stroller cover if needed
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn are ideal; Winter visits are possible but expect mud, wetter conditions, and shorter daylight.
